result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell R Luther was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber and good time granted.
Credit for 1 day if revoked.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must report to Probation by 3:00 PM on Wednesday, September 16, 2015.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell R Luther

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mitchell R Luther in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State moves to amend Count 1 to misdemeanor 961.41(3g)(e) - Granted.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1 as amended.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Count 2 is Dismissed and Read In.  Attorney O'Hara relates.  Court relates and orders:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence
30 days jail - Huber and good time granted - Credit for 1 day - STAYED

1 year Probation (Must report to Probation by 3:00 PM on Wednesday)
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent
Court costs

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court.

Defendant Mitchell R Luther in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Information previously filed; 
Plea of Not Guilty;  

Defenses motion to suppress evidence;  
11:34 - Sgt Kenneth Tomesh with RLPD called, sworn, direct by state

11:39  cross by Attorney OHara
11:46  Re-direct by the State
11:47  Re-cross by Defense
Court makes factual findings;   Parties to do briefs by August 11, 2015;   Court will make a decision within a week.


  Plea hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
of attorney Ryan O'Hara in support of Defendant's motion to suppress.

Defendant Mitchell R Luther in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:55  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over.
Arraignment set.
Bond to continue.  Arraignment scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Defendant Mitchell R Luther in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Defendant Mitchell R Luther in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Qualifies for Public Defender.  Bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:45 am.
